alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 3:16AM PST until December 23 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM THURSDAY TO 4 PM PST SUNDAY... * CHANGES...Winter Storm Warning changed to 4 AM Thursday. * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 5000 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, except 4 to 8 inches west of highway 395. Local snowfall totals to a foot above 5500 feet south and west of Susanville and near Yuba Pass. Below 5000 feet, 0 to 2 inches is possible. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 18 inches, except 2 to 5 feet west of highway 395 above 5000 feet. * WHERE...Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 AM Thursday to 4 PM PST Sunday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 7 PM this evening to 4 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be slow through Wednesday before becoming very difficult to impossible through the remainder of the holiday weekend. There may be a break in heavier snow late Thursday night and Friday.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the major storm arrives Wednesday night, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
